title: 75/61. United Nations study on disarmament and non-proliferation education

paragraphs.1: Expresses its appreciation to the Member States, the United Nations and other international and regional organizations, civil society and academic and non-governmental organizations, which, within their purview, implemented the recommendations made in the United Nations study, as discussed in the report of the Secretary-General reviewing the implementation of the recommendations, and encourages them once again to continue to apply those recommendations and report to the Secretary-General on steps taken to implement them;
paragraphs.2: Encourages Member States, the United Nations, relevant specialized agencies and regional and subregional organizations to continue considering developing and implementing policies and educational programmes for young people to increase and facilitate their constructive engagement in the field of disarmament and non-proliferation;
paragraphs.3: Requests the Secretary-General to prepare a report reviewing the results of the implementation of the recommendations and possible new opportunities for promoting disarmament and non-proliferation education, and to submit it to the General Assembly at its seventy-seventh session;
paragraphs.4: Expresses its appreciation to the Secretary-General for his disarmament agenda, Securing Our Common Future: An Agenda for Disarmament, and notes the proposed actions therein to further advance disarmament and non-proliferation education, as well as those actions championed and supported by Member States;
paragraphs.6: Requests the Secretary-General to maintain and update the website “Disarmament education: resources for learning”, including the Disarmament Today series of podcasts, as an efficient and effective tool to promote disarmament and non-proliferation education;
paragraphs.7: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-seventh session, under the item entitled “General and complete disarmament”, the sub-item entitled “Disarmament and non-proliferation education”.
